tracks.text: In a garage full of storage, Vanessa Carlton walks through a doorway. She has long brown hair, braided around her right side. Strands of hair dangle in front of her face. She wears a black V neck shirt and red wrist warmers.
Carlton pulls aside a blanket, revealing a polished brown baby grand piano with white trim and decorations.
She sits and the piano. She, the piano, and we pull back from the garage.
In the drive way, a husband kisses his wife and baby. He's wearing a suit and holding a briefcase.
Carlton plays and sings to us as we ride down a subsurban street.
Kids wearing party hats play on a bouncy castle in a suburban front yard. American flags flap in the distance and 2 kids skateboard by.
We ride along a suburban road, past a man cutting a lawn. A teenage boy does a flip on a trampoline.
Carlton continues to play and sing to us as we ride down a 2 lane highway. Behind the piano, 4 men on motorcycles ride behind us. They wear black jackets and have long, white beards.
By the side of the road, a 10 foot tall hut is covered in license plates and hub caps. The hut overlooks a scenic mountain range.
The bikers pass us. We continue down the winding 2 lane highway through the mountains.
Marathon runners run behind us.
A brown and white spotted owl sits on the piano, next to Carlton. Neither acknowledge each other. The owl watches the world go by.
Without the owl, Carlton pauses next to a string quintent, playing on the sidewalk of a bridge. In the distance, we can see dozens of skyscrapers, including a cylindrical one at the center.
We travel down an urban road.
We pass a Mexican product wholesaler, a Los Angeles Metro bus, and signs for parking, jewelry, and photo booths.
Behind the piano is a parade. A dozen women in black, white, and glittering blue wave blue and red streamers. A marching band follows behind them.
Black horses gallop on a beach.
In close up, she sings to us, with glittering brown eyes and pink lips.
We ride down an urban street, past a sporting goods store, a movie theater, a Burger King, and a construction zone for another sky scraper.
Night begins to fall. Her hands move quickly across the piano keys.
Carlton looks up. With the last bit of light in the sky, we see the skyscrapers tower above us, with a cylindrical one in the center.
At night, we pass poorly lit, closed buildings.
We pause as teenagers in loose clothes breakdance on the sidewalk. Next to their boombox, a silver living statue does robot dance moves.
We ride through a tunnel, and pass other, boxy skyscrapers.
We pass several stores. The Rite Aid is the only one open.
Back where we started, a husband in a suit and his wife in a cocktail dress walk toward their front door. Carlton looks at us as the piano retuns to the garage.
She finishes playing, smiles to herself, and gets up
She leaves the garage. Fade to black.
